subsection.title: Solving Equations
subsection.p: We solve an equation by isolating the variable on one side of the equation. If an equation involves two or more operations, we must undo those operations in reverse order.

subsection.title: Applied Problems
subsection.p: Problem solving often involves signed numbers, either in the equation that models the problem or in its solution, or both.

statement.p:

Write an equation for the population P of trout x years from now.
When will the Park Service have to restock the lake?
Graph your equation for P, and illustrate your answer to part (b) on the graph.

subsection.title: Solving Inequalities

assemblage.title: Inequality
assemblage.p: A statement that uses one of the symbols \gt or \lt is called an inequality.

subsection.p: Examples of inequalities are -1 \gt -3 ~~~~~~ \text{and}~~~~~~ x \lt 2 Unlike the equations we have studied, which have at most one solution, an inequality can have infinitely many solutions. A solution of an equation or inequality is said to satisfysatisfy an equation or inequality the equation or inequality.

statement.p: Solve the inequality ~x \lt 2

solution.p: The solutions include 1, 0, -1, -2 and all the other negative integers, as well as fractions less than 2, such as 1\dfrac{3}{5},~ \dfrac{2}{3}, and \dfrac{-17}{8}. All of these values satisfy the inequality ~x \lt 2.

subsection.p: The rules for solving inequalities are very similar to the rules for solving equations, with one important difference. In the Activities we will develop the following strategies for solving inequalities.

ol.li: We can add or subtract the same quantity on both sides.
We can multiply or divide both sides by the same positive number.
If we multiply or divide both sides by a negative number, we must reverse the direction of the inequality.

statement.p: Solve ~-3x+1 \gt 7,~ and graph the solutions on a number line.

subsection.title: Compound Inequalities
subsection.p: An inequality in which the variable expression is bounded from above and from below is called a compound inequality For example, -3 \lt 2x-5 \le 6 is a compound inequality. To solve a compound inequality, we must perform the steps needed to isolate x on all three sides of the inequality.

statement.p: Solve ~-3 \lt 2x-5 \le 6
When do we need to reverse the direction of an inequality?

answer.p: When we multiply or divide by a negative number.

statement.p: What is a compound inequality?

answer.p: One in which the variable expression is bounded from above and from below.
